body_content.explanation: a bush or small tree of the acacia family, found in America and grown in other places, with thorns (= sharp points) and groups of yellow flowers that are used to make perfume (= liquid with a pleasant smell, often used on the skin) because of their strong, pleasant smell:
examples: Huisache and prickly pear bloomed here then, just as they do now.
The green tops of mesquite and huisache trees dot the surface near the shore.
